snippet: Saudi Arabia has agreed to an American request to provide a base to train moderate Syrian opposition fighters, officials said.
abstract: Saudi Arabia agrees to American request to provide a base to train moderate Syrian opposition fighters; Secretary of State John Kerry is preparing to fly to Saudi Arabia for a high-level strategy session on how to counter Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; meeting will also include senior officials from Arab states in the Persian Gulf region, as well as Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Turkey and Iraq.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Amman, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia has agreed to an American request to provide a base to train moderate Syrian opposition fighters, officials said.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Will Grant U.S. Request for Anti-ISIS Training Program
headline.print_headline: Granting U.S. Request, Saudis to Host Program to Train Anti-ISIS Force
